page.title: 19SACREWELL FARM 2
page.content: {MECHANIZATION} Machinery enables just four workers to cultivate the 215.7 hectares of land. There are three stages in the development of a crop: preparation of seedbed, sowing seed and promoting healthy growth, and harvesting. Machines used in these processes are ploughs, cultivators, harrows, seed drills, sprayers, fertiliser spreaders and harvesting machinery for each crop. {IRRIGATION AND FERTILISER } The farm has a permit to pump from the river 22 million gallons of water annually. There is also a man made reservoir dug in blue clay at the northern end of the farm which can hold 17 million gallons of water. Artificial nitrates, phosphates and potash are used on the light loam soil.
